intro: Vernonia mandonii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually lavender to blue-purple in color, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. Vernonia mandonii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
